If you'd like to learn more about R coding and data science, here are some more resources you can refer to! 

### Resources for learning about data visualizations

[Presentation with data visualization warm-ups](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1aQmF7ADHeU932y5Oqt0jAgjYDaE-_0bd80ZPqSfFy8A/edit?usp=sharing)

[NYT What's Going on in this Graph Lessons](https://www.nytimes.com/column/whats-going-on-in-this-graph)

[NASA Interactive Graphs - Vital Signs of the Planet](https://climate.nasa.gov/explore/interactives)

### Websites for creating graphs (that don't require coding)

[Raw Graphs](https://www.rawgraphs.io)

[CODAP](https://concord.org/our-work/research-projects/codap/)

### Tutorial websites

[Biology Tutorials used in Lewis & Clark College intro to biology courses](https://lewis-and-clark-data-science.github.io/BIO-110-Web-Tutorials/)
